adjectives.description: ruffianly (comparative more ruffianly, superlative most ruffianly)

entries.meaning: Like or having the qualities of a ruffian. [from 16th c.]
examples: Joseph mumbled indistinctly in the depth of the cellar, but gave no intimation of ascending; so his master dived down to him, leaving me vis-à-vis the ruffianly bitch and a pair of grim shaggy sheepdogs […].

adverbs.description: ruffianly (comparative more ruffianly, superlative most ruffianly)

entries.meaning: In the manner of a ruffian.
